intro: Daphniphyllum phanrangense, commonly known as the Phanrang holly, is a species of evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, preferring acidic soils. Its ornamental value is due to its dense foliage and winter-blooming habits. Daphniphyllum phanrangense is also noted for its slow growth and ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
